description:
SpiderWeb Solitaire is a variation of classic Spider Solitaire card game, if you feel that classic Spider is too hard or boring try this one. 

FEATURES: 
- Large and eye-friendly card set, optimized for fingers and long play 
- Intuitive cards dragging system 
- Optional timed game, scoring and statistics 
- Unlimited undo 
- Automatic cards turnover and other helpful time-saving assistance 

RULES: 
Number of Decks: 1 (52 cards) 

Layout: At the beginning you will see the deck in the upper left corner, the reserve or Web to the right of the deck, and below them there are the seven columns of the tableau. At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to the first 3 piles and 3 cards to the remaining piles. The deck is formed by 28 cards. 

Object: The goal of the game is to group all the cards in sets of 13 cards in sequence down in suit from King to Ace. 

Play: As the game begins, Spider Web Solitaire deals twenty-four cards from the deck into the tableau. 

Clicking on the stock deals one card to each tableau pile. All empty spaces must be filled before a dial. 

Cards within the tableau should be build in descending sequence regardless of suit. Groups of cards in sequence down in suit may be moved as a unit. 

Reserve - storage location for any number of cards. Any available card or legal group of cards may be moved here. The top cards is available for play on the tableau.
